contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Victoria-Trafalgar Dock entrance.jpg|thumb|right|Gateway to Victoria Dock]] '''Victoria Dock''' was a dock on the [[River Mersey]], [[England]] and part of the [[Port of Liverpool]]. Situated in the northern dock system, it was connected to [[Trafalgar Dock]] to the north and [[West Waterloo Dock]] to the south. It was designed by [[Jesse Hartley]] and opened in 1836. Between 1844 and 1921, the [[Ordnance Datum]] for the British Isles was taken from the level of the Victoria Dock.<ref>{{citation|url=http://benchmarks.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/pls/htmldb/f?p=111:7:1061530619354143535::NO:7::|title=Datum height differences|publisher=Ordnance Survey|accessdate=7 April 2008}}</ref> In 1972, the body of the dock was filled in as part of the construction of a ferry terminal for the [[British_and_Irish_Steam_Packet_Company|B&I Line]].<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.irishseashipping.com/heritage/subsite/england/liverpool_biterminal/liverpool_bitermina.htm|title=Liverpool's Lost Sea Terminal|publisher=irishseashipping.com|accessdate=9 March 2009}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Victoria Dock, Liverpool|Victoria Dock}} * {{Cite web |url=http://www.liverpool2007.org.uk/docks/docks2.htm |title=Liverpool North Docks diagram |publisher=Liverpool 2007 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20070330201457/http://www.liverpool2007.org.uk/docks/docks2.htm |archivedate=30 March 2007 }} {{coord|53.4155|-3.0014|display=title|region:GB_scale:2000}} {{Port of Liverpool docks}} {{Merseyside-struct-stub}} [[Category:Liverpool docks|Victoria Dock]]
